info.title: Admin Reports API
info.description: Allows the administrators of Google Apps customers to fetch reports about the usage, collaboration, security and risk for their users.

get.description: Retrieves a list of activities for a specific customer and application.

parameters.name: actorIpAddress
parameters.description: IP Address of host where the event was performed. Supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Application name for which the events are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Represents the customer for which the data is to be fetched.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Return events which occured at or before this time.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Name of the event being queried.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Event parameters in the form [parameter1 name][operator][parameter1 value],[parameter2 name][operator][parameter2 value],...

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Number of activity records to be shown in each page.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Token to specify next page.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Return events which occured at or after this time.

parameters.name: userKey
parameters.description: Represents the profile id or the user email for which the data should be filtered. When 'all' is specified as the userKey, it returns usageReports for all users.

parameters.name: actorIpAddress
parameters.description: IP Address of host where the event was performed. Supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

parameters.name: applicationName
parameters.description: Application name for which the events are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Represents the customer for which the data is to be fetched.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: Return events which occured at or before this time.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.description: Name of the event being queried.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Event parameters in the form [parameter1 name][operator][parameter1 value],[parameter2 name][operator][parameter2 value],...

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Number of activity records to be shown in each page.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Token to specify next page.

parameters.name: startTime
parameters.description: Return events which occured at or after this time.

parameters.name: userKey
parameters.description: Represents the profile id or the user email for which the data should be filtered. When 'all' is specified as the userKey, it returns usageReports for all users.

post.description: Stop watching resources through this channel

get.description: Retrieves a report which is a collection of properties / statistics for a specific customer.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Represents the customer for which the data is to be fetched.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Represents the date in yyyy-mm-dd format for which the data is to be fetched.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Token to specify next page.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Represents the application name, parameter name pairs to fetch in csv as app_name1:param_name1, app_name2:param_name2.

get.description: Retrieves a report which is a collection of properties / statistics for a set of users.

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: Represents the customer for which the data is to be fetched.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Represents the date in yyyy-mm-dd format for which the data is to be fetched.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description: Represents the set of filters including parameter operator value.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return. Maximum allowed is 1000

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description: Token to specify next page.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Represents the application name, parameter name pairs to fetch in csv as app_name1:param_name1, app_name2:param_name2.

parameters.name: userKey
parameters.description: Represents the profile id or the user email for which the data should be filtered.

Activities.description: JSON template for a collection of activites.

kind.description: Kind of list response this is.

nextPageToken.description: Token for retrieving the next page

Activity.description: JSON template for the activity resource.

key.description: For OAuth 2LO API requests, consumer_key of the requestor.

profileId.description: Obfuscated user id of the user.

parameters.description: Parameter value pairs for various applications.

id.description: Unique identifier for each activity record.

applicationName.description: Application name to which the event belongs.

customerId.description: Obfuscated customer ID of the source customer.

time.description: Time of occurrence of the activity.

uniqueQualifier.description: Unique qualifier if multiple events have the same time.

ipAddress.description: IP Address of the user doing the action.

Channel.description: An notification channel used to watch for resource changes.

address.description: The address where notifications are delivered for this channel.

expiration.description: Date and time of notification channel expiration, expressed as a Unix timestamp, in milliseconds. Optional.

id.description: A UUID or similar unique string that identifies this channel.

kind.description: Identifies this as a notification channel used to watch for changes to a resource. Value: the fixed string "api#channel".

params.description: Additional parameters controlling delivery channel behavior. Optional.

additionalProperties.description: Declares a new parameter by name.

payload.description: A Boolean value to indicate whether payload is wanted. Optional.

resourceId.description: An opaque ID that identifies the resource being watched on this channel. Stable across different API versions.

resourceUri.description: A version-specific identifier for the watched resource.

token.description: An arbitrary string delivered to the target address with each notification delivered over this channel. Optional.

type.description: The type of delivery mechanism used for this channel.

UsageReport.description: JSON template for a usage report.

date.description: The date to which the record belongs.

entity.description: Information about the type of the item.

customerId.description: Obfuscated customer id for the record.

profileId.description: Obfuscated user id for the record.

type.description: The type of item, can be a customer or user.

parameters.description: Parameter value pairs for various applications.

datetimeValue.description: RFC 3339 formatted value of the parameter.

msgValue.description: Nested message value of the parameter.

UsageReports.description: JSON template for a collection of usage reports.

nextPageToken.description: Token for retrieving the next page

data.description: Key-Value pairs to give detailed information on the warning.

key.description: Key associated with a key-value pair to give detailed information on the warning.

value.description: Value associated with a key-value pair to give detailed information on the warning.

message.description: Human readable message for the warning.

fields.name: fields
fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.name: key
key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.name: oauth_token
oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.name: prettyPrint
prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.name: quotaUser
quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters. Overrides userIp if both are provided.

userIp.name: userIp
userIp.description: IP address of the site where the request originates. Use this if you want to enforce per-user limits.

scopes.https://www.googleapis.com/auth/admin.re: View audit reports of Google Apps for your domain
View usage reports of Google Apps for your domain
